meanings.sent1: The tall fence was obstructive, making it hard to see the other side.
meanings.sent2: The fallen tree was obstructive, blocking the path through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn door was being obstructive, refusing to open for anyone.
meanings.sent4: His loud music was obstructive, drowning out all other sounds in the room.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog was obstructive, making it impossible to see more than a few feet ahead.

meanings.sent1: The narrow hallway was obstructive, causing a traffic jam during rush hour.
meanings.sent2: The overgrown bushes were obstructive, hiding the entrance to the secret garden.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was being obstructive, sitting right in the middle of the doorway.
meanings.sent4: Her strict rules were obstructive, preventing any fun activities during the party.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rain was obstructive, making it difficult to drive safely on the slippery roads.
